Prilotekal<tm tmtype="reg"/> Indications and dose

Spinal anaesthesia

By intrathecal injection

  • Adult

    Usual dose 40–60 mg (max. per dose 80 mg), dose may need to be reduced in elderly or debilitated patients, or in late pregnancy.

 National funding/access decisions

Scottish Medicines Consortium (SMC) Decisions

With intrathecal use

The Scottish Medicines Consortium has advised (December 2010) that prilocaine 2% hyperbaric solution for injection (Prilotekal ) is accepted for restricted use within NHS Scotland for use in spinal anaesthesia in ambulatory surgery settings.
